title: Understanding the Interaction Between Media Ecology and Distance Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy and comprehension of secondary-level mathematics concepts
context.additional_context: Text-Centered Discussion Activity Design Optimized for Smartphone-Based Learning Environments

learning_goals: In remote education settings, learners can explain core concepts of media ecology (orality vs. literacy) through text-based information acquisition processes.
Learners can analyze how characteristics of online media affect comprehension in math learning, linking findings to specific cases.
Learners can propose at least two communication strategies for effective knowledge transfer in resource-constrained technological environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
